intro: Oenothera pellegrinii, commonly known as the Pellegrini's evening primrose, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy yellow or orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. Its stems are often branched and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Oenothera pellegrinii is part of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
